description: In Turkmenistan, on March 30, 2020, it was announced that spring break in schools is going to be extended for one week until April 6 by decision of Ministry of Education. It was done as a preventive measure against the spread of the COVID-19.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Turkmenistan, on March 30, 2020, it was announced that spring break in schools is going to be extended for one week until April 6 by decision of Ministry of Education. It was done as a preventive measure against the spread of the COVID-19.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Schoolchildren of the Turkmen Dashgouz must come to the first lesson in the new school year, which starts on September 1, 2020, with individual sanitary bags. The class teachers and teachers explained to the parents of the students how these bags will look and what they will contain. A sanitary kit in a self-sewn bag should include wet and dry wipes, hand sanitizer, a tube of oxolinic ointment, a protective face mask, and disinfectant to clean your desk and chair. This requirement, along with an instruction to call the parents of future Dashgouz students, was sent to schools by the leadership of the local education system. According to the teacher of the school #7 of Dashgouz, children without a sanitary bag with the appropriate filling will not be admitted to classes.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On March 2, 2020, Turkmenistan's Ministry of Health recommended citizens to refrain from traveling abroad.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Starting from March 17, 2020, those wishing to visit Turkmenistan must have a certificate confirming that they are free of coronavirus. Travelers who have recently visited any of the countries where the COVID-19 virus has been detected will be required to undergo a medical examination upon entry and may be expelled from the country or quarantined for up to 24 days, if confirmed with COVID-19. The cost of tests and stay in quarantine will be at least $300, and must be paid by the person who entered Turkmenistan.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Starting from March 17, 2020, those wishing to visit Turkmenistan must have a certificate confirming that they are free of coronavirus. Travelers who have recently visited any of the countries where the COVID-19 virus has been detected will be required to undergo a medical examination upon entry and may be expelled from the country or quarantined for up to 24 days, if confirmed with COVID-19. The cost of tests and stay in quarantine will be at least $300, and must be paid by the person who entered Turkmenistan.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Starting from March 20 to April 20, foreign citizens are not allowed to cross the state border of Turkmenistan.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: "Turkmenistan has relaunched imports of Iranian food products and other basic goods...on April 12." UPDATE: The border with Iran was originally closed. It has reopened for the importation of food on April 12.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting from April 20, all trucks and railways that enter the territory of Turkmenistan will now be disinfected.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On March 23, people entering the Ashgabat, Turkmenistan are "required to have their temperature taken." UPDATE: The restricted access into Ashgabt was lifted on March 23. Now they have changed to health screening (i.e. revised the way of restricting)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On April 3, 2020, it was announced that Turkmenistan bought 2,000 packages containing 20 capsules each of the anti flu drug. This drug is being tested in China in regards to coronavirus treatment. It was developed in Russia.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On April 21, Turkmenistan authorities announced a new policy on border checkpoints that will be equipped with disinfection facilities.
The policy states that in the event of any circumstances that may harm the health of the population, in order to provide for special and more enhanced additional types of control at checkpoints, disinfection barriers for vehicles and facilities are built and equipped for disinfection of road and rail transport. Disinfection works against insects, plants, and products brought by the vehicles.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On May 5, a leader in Turkmenistan "ordered the creation of reserve stock of medications and medical equipment and arrangement in the country of the production of some of their [equipment] types."
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The main pharmacy association of the Ministry of Health and Medical Industry of Turkmenistan will purchase antiviral drugs in Russia “in the required volumes”. The corresponding decree was signed by President Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov on July 8.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Turkmenistan, the Ashgabat enterprise for the production of medical cotton wool and cosmetic cotton products is preparing to launch a line for the production of disposable medical masks. It was announced on August 7.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 9, the President of Turkmenistan "ordered to analyze the health status of all citizens of Turkmenistan and to take care of necessary preventive measures." This will mean that "special groups of medical workers will be created, the check-ups should be started from kindergartens, secondary and higher educational institutions, said the president."
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Students of schools of the Lebap region in Turkmenistan were tested for the coronavirus COVID-19 on April 12. The checks are scheduled to be completed by April 16. According to the newspaper's Ashgabat correspondent, similar testing began on April 10 in some capital schools and kindergartens, while in others it is planned to be held on April 21-26.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Employees of state institutions in Ashgabat were ordered to pass COVID-19 tests in polyclinics. The order was issued on August 6. Those who do not bring a certificate of the absence of coronavirus will not be allowed to work. At the same time, sources in medical institutions say that it is forbidden to write a diagnosis in a certificate with a positive analysis. Physicians are obliged to report the results themselves at the patient's place of work so that they can be sent to the hospital. The analysis in polyclinics is paid, state employees must pay 100 manats ($ 28.5) for it.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: In Turkmenistan, the government newspaper Neutral Turkmenistan on July 23 urged citizens to wash their hands, wear masks, and maintain social distance to avoid intestinal infections.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting from March 19, 2020, Turkmenistan authorities closed borders between regions.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 25, Turkmenistan's media announced that the government has established additional control points around large cities, including Ashgabat. Before entering, drivers' and passengers' temperatures are checked.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Starting from March 19, Turkmenistan authorities closed borders between regions. Also, those citizens who do not have Ashgabat residence permit are now unable to enter the capital. The reason for border closure has not been announced.

On June 3, the policy has been relaxed, so that now citizens can travel between the regions, but they are required to a health certificate given by healthcare institutions or a police permit (internal authorities), or a document confirming a business trip. To pass the required checks, passengers must arrive at the train station at least 45 minutes before the train leaves. UPDATE: The original policy totally restricted movement between the regions in Turkmenistan, the updated policy states that citizens can travel between the regions with medical certificates.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On July 13, 2020, the "Turkmen Railways" website announced the suspension of train traffic from 16 to 23 July in Turkmenistan. The reasons were not announced.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On July 13, the "Turkmen Railways" website announced the suspension of train traffic from 16 to 23 July in Turkmenistan. The reasons were not announced. 
On July 31, it was announced that the suspension was extended until August 15. UPDATE: The original policy was set to last until July 13, it has been extended until August 15.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Turkmenistan, movement between the regions has been mainly done by the bus service and only in the direction of sanatoriums. Starting from July 27, 2020, the movement by busses has been completely suspended.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting from August 5, for flights within Turkmenistan, passengers are obliged to provide a medical certificate that states the absence of COVID-19. From August 10, the validity of such a certificate will be reduced from two weeks to three days. It will be possible to obtain a certificate from family doctors in polyclinics at the place of residence. In order to obtain a certificate, it is necessary to pass a general blood test and undergo lung fluorography.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On July 13, the "Turkmen Railways" website announced the suspension of train traffic from 16 to 23 July in Turkmenistan. The reasons were not announced.
On August 15, it was announced that the policy is extended until September 1. UPDATE: The original policy was set to last until July 23, then it was extended until August 15, and now until September 1.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On July 13, the "Turkmen Railways" website announced the suspension of train traffic from 16 to 23 July in Turkmenistan. The reasons were not announced.
On August 28, it was announced that the policy is again extended until October 1. UPDATE: The original policy was set to last until July 23, then it was extended until August 15, then until September 1, and now it has been extended until October 1.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 9, 2020, the President of Turkmenistan ordered to analyze the health status of all groups of the country's population and in this regard, special groups of medical workers will be created in etraps and cities, which will begin to carry out systematic checks in accordance with the appropriate schedule. According to the head of Turkmenistan, the checks should be started in kindergartens, secondary and higher educational institutions.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 18, 2020, President of Turkmenistan Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov held a working meeting on digitalization of media and document management. It was attended by Deputy Prime Minister for Culture and Media Bakhargul Abdyeva and Deputy Prime Minister for Transport, Communications and Industry Bayramgeldi Ovezov.
During the meeting, Berdymukhamedov ordered to accelerate the transition to digital media. In particular, according to the President, the current reason for the transition to a digital system is the spread of a dangerous disease caused by a new type of coronavirus in the world.
In this regard, the officials were instructed to prepare a draft concept for the development of the e-government system as soon as possible.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 23, Turkmenistan has developed a temporary regulation on the movement of export, import and transit cargo through the territory of Turkmenistan. "Goods arriving by car through the customs checkpoints "Garabogaz" and "Farap" and following further on the territory of Turkmenistan will be transported by Turkmen cargo carriers." "The transfer of goods delivered in trailers or semi-trailers will be carried out in non-contact conditions at the state border in certain places.""Also, starting from March 24, all types of cargo that will arrive at the international seaport of Turkmenbashi should be loaded in trailers and semi-trailers to sea vessels and sent without accompanying individuals and without motor transport."
type_text: Turkmenistan has set up special regulations during this time in the manners in which cargo can be moved with minimal human contact.

description: On April 8, 2020, it was reported that "on the first school day after the spring break Ashgabat (Turkmenistan) schoolchildren have been informed that they have to make money contributions of 100 manats for the disinfection campaign."
type_text: After a required school disinfection, the gov't required schoolchildren to pay 100 manats.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Turkmenistan sends humanitarian aid to the Russian city of Astrakhan in the form of "groceries and manufactured goods, textile and construction materials" reported on May 6, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: As one of the preventive measures to reduce potential risks, the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection of the Population of Turkmenistan starting from July 18, recommends that the heads of enterprises and organizations of all forms of ownership give leave to workers of high-risk groups. There are no clear criteria for identifying workers in the risk group.
type_text: The government recommended employers and heads of organizations to allow a leave for employees of high-risk groups
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On August 22, 2020, the president of Turkmenistan issued a new law, punishing evasion of treatment of dangerous infectious diseases of an epidemic or pandemic nature with imprisonment for up to two years, in case of a repeated crime - up to 5 years. Individuals who assist violators will also be punished with up to three years in prison and deprivation of the right to hold certain positions.
type_text: The government of Turkmenistan issued a new law punishing those who evade treatment of infectious diseases.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: Turkmenistan announced that it had rolled out a public health campaign targeted at school children and other citizens, February 7, 2020.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On February 10, 2020, it became known that the administration of Ashgabat (Turkmenistan) is informing its citizens about the coronavirus by distributing special booklets. They are distributed in hospitals and clinics, as well as in factories, in schools, and are handed out when going around houses.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: In Turkmenistan citizens "are forbidden to talk about coronavirus," as reported on March 26.
In Turkmenistan, starting from March 25, 2020, children in schools are taught the importance of personal hygiene, especially handwashing with soap.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On March 25, 2020, it was announced that in Turkmenistan print and electronic media disseminate recommendations of international organizations (WHO and UNICEF) and the Turkmen Ministry of Health on how to prevent the spread of coronavirus.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In connection with the pandemic of the new viral infection COVID-19 announced by the WHO, a 24/7 hotline was launched in Turkmenistan on April 1, 2020. It was launched by the Ministry of Health and Medical Industry in order to inform the population about the epidemiological situation in the country, measures taken to prevent the import of coronavirus and methods of protection and prevention from this disease.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The State Committee for Television and Radio Broadcasting and Cinematography of Turkmenistan, together with UNICEF, launched hygiene videos, the UN press center said on July 17, 2020. In the commercials, a popular Turkmen comedian and host tells how to “wash your hands, ensure food safety, observe etiquette when sneezing and coughing, keep surfaces clean and call a doctor if someone in your family has symptoms of illness”. The videos are broadcasted throughout the day on national TV channels of Turkmenistan. A total of five videos will be released.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Ashgabat, Turkmenistan, parents of schoolchildren were obliged to give notes that they would explain anti-epidemic rules to children. They were given forms with ready-made text to sign, but there is no mention of COVID-19, Turkmen news reports. The document says that parents will be responsible for "properly educating their child about wearing a face mask, keeping hands clean, and maintaining a safe distance during the 2020-2021 school year."
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Turkmenistan has "put quarantine measures in place for foreign travelers arriving at airports as of Sunday, February 9, 2020." They may be put into hospitals if they show symptoms or have travel histories from places with the virus.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: On July 21, 2020, it was announced that from July 21 to August 1, 2020, all markets, large shopping centers (excluding grocery and FMCG departments), cinemas, theaters, parks, game attractions, museums, beauty salons, hairdressing salons, saunas, laundries, and sewing ateliers, fitness clubs and swimming pools, short-term paid courses and game centers are closed in Turkmenistan. Restaurants will work only in delivery mode.

description: In Turkmenistan, announced on April 9, "authorities of Ashgabat have imposed restrictions on the number of guests at weddings," with "no more than 200 people can be invited for family celebrations such as weddings, anniversaries and birthday parties."

The Turkmenistan Football League was indefinitely suspended on March 24. On April 19 it will begin again with fans. UPDATE: The Turkmenistan Football League was indefinitely suspended on March 24. On April 19 it will begin again with fans.

description: In Turkmenistan, in the city of Turkmenabat, in the Lebap province, mosques have been shuttered for disinfection and will remain closed until May 1.
Starting from July 16, 2020, in Turkmenistan, in order to counter the spread of infectious diseases, mosques, churches, and Muslim shrines for pilgrimage have been closed for an indefinite period.

description: Starting from July 16, in Turkmenistan, in order to counter the spread of infectious diseases, mosques, churches, and Muslim shrines for pilgrimage have been closed for an indefinite period. The original policy did not have an end date, on September 3, the policy has been updated to last until October 1. UPDATE: The original policy did not have an end date, on September 3, the policy has been updated to last until October 1.

description: In Turkmenistan, on July 13, 2020, the website of the state information agency published an announcement from the Ministry of Health and Medical Industry of Turkmenistan a warning that the amount of dust in the air is 21% higher than normal. In this regard, the citizens of Turkmenistan are recommended to wear medical masks "to prevent adverse effects on the body of climatic conditions while on the street and in public places."
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
